Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: Titled "The Clash of the Empires" and created by renowned artist Vitelli di Bernotelli in 1405 as indicated by the plaque affixed to the base, this massive and imposing structure displays in remarkable detail the history of struggle between the six key nations of the continent. Standing atop what appears to be the tangled remains of subjugated peoples and ruinous remains, six larger than life marble statues of men in the midst of heated combat create a stunning display of power and martial prowess frozen in time. Higher atop the fountain stands a female form in fluid, flowing robes, her hands outstretched to the sky with a desperate expression upon her finely featured face. Clearly representing Madonna, the mother of Christ, the waters of the fountain spray upward from her outstretched hands to shower down in a cascading spray of water to land around the figures of the embattled men, trickling in rivulets down the base of the statue to pool in the circular basin that surrounds the entire structure.
